title: Health: Medicine (Usefulness 1-5)
description: Traveler usefulness 1-5/10 phrases for the Medicine subcategory within Health. Includes 5 card(s).

cards.english: Because of Seirogan's strong smell, the pharmaceutical company that produces it invented a sugar-coated tablet version, which many people prefer.
cards.romaji: Seirogan wa nioi ga tsuyoi node, t ij taipu ga hatsubai sare, ku no hito ni konomarete imasu.
cards.japanese: 正露丸は匂いが強いので、糖衣タイプが発売され、多くの人に好まれています。

cards.english: Muhi is one of the longest selling anti-itch creams in Japan.
cards.romaji: muhi wa, nihon de nagaku tsukawareteiru kayumi dome desu.
cards.japanese: ムヒは、日本で長く使われているかゆみ止めです。

cards.english: From children to the elderly, Japanese people use hot or cold pads for muscle pains and injuries.
cards.romaji: kodomo kara otona made, hiroi sedai no nihonjin ga itami ya kega ni shippu o tsukaimasu.
cards.japanese: 子供から大人まで、幅広い世代の日本人が痛みや怪我にシップを使います。

cards.english: TV commercials for cold medicines are broadcast more often in winter.
cards.romaji: kazegusuri no sh.emu wa, fuyu ni yoku nagaremasu.
cards.japanese: 風邪薬のコマーシャルは、冬によく流れます。

cards.english: There are around fifteen major types of headache medicines available without prescription in Japan.
cards.romaji: Nihon dewa, shoh sen no iranai zuts.yakuga yaku j.go shurui mo arimasu.
cards.japanese: 日本では、処方箋のいらない頭痛薬が約十五種類もあります。
